intro: Melandrium nemorale, commonly known as the wood spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant has smooth, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Melandrium nemorale is typically found in woodland areas and is adapted to moist, shaded environments.
